This module implements a simple logger. It is based on the following design:
  • Runtime log formating is a bug: Sooner or later every log file is parsed.
  • Keep it simple: If this library does not fullfill your needs, write your own. Trying to support every logging feature just leads to bloat.

Format is:

DEBUG|INFO|... (2009-11-02 00:00:00)? (Component: )? Message

Imports

strutils, os, times

Types

TLevel* = enum 
  lvlAll,                     ## all levels active
  lvlDebug,                   ## debug level (and any above) active
  lvlInfo,                    ## info level (and any above) active
  lvlWarn,                    ## warn level (and any above) active
  lvlError,                   ## error level (and any above) active
  lvlFatal,                   ## fatal level (and any above) active
  lvlNone
logging level 
TLogger* = object of TObject
  levelThreshold*: TLevel     ## only messages of level >= levelThreshold
                              ## should be processed
  fmtStr*: string             ## = defaultFmtStr by default, see substituteLog for $date etc.
abstract logger; the base type of all loggers 
TConsoleLogger* = object of TLogger
logger that writes the messages to the console 
TFileLogger* = object of TLogger
  f: TFile
logger that writes the messages to a file 
TRollingFileLogger* = object of TFileLogger
  maxLines: int
  curLine: int
  baseName: string
  logFiles: int
logger that writes the message to a file

Vars

level* = lvlAll
global log filter 
handlers*: seq[ref TLogger] = @ []
handlers with their own log levels

Consts

LevelNames*: array[TLevel, string] = ["DEBUG", "DEBUG", "INFO", "WARN", "ERROR", 
                                      "FATAL", "NONE"]
defaultFmtStr* = ""
default string between log level and message per logger 
verboseFmtStr* = "$date $time "

Procs

proc substituteLog*(frmt: string): string
converts $date to the current date converts $time to the current time converts $app to getAppFilename() converts 
proc defaultFilename*(): string
returns the default filename for a logger 
proc newConsoleLogger*(levelThreshold = lvlAll): ref TConsoleLogger
proc newFileLogger*(filename = defaultFilename(); mode: TFileMode = fmAppend; 
                    levelThreshold = lvlAll): ref TFileLogger
proc newRollingFileLogger*(filename = defaultFilename(); 
                           mode: TFileMode = fmReadWrite; 
                           levelThreshold = lvlAll; maxLines = 1000): ref TRollingFileLogger

Methods

method log*(L: ref TLogger; level: TLevel; frmt: string; 
            args: varargs[string, `$`])
override this method in custom loggers. Default implementation does nothing. 
method log*(L: ref TConsoleLogger; level: TLevel; frmt: string; 
            args: varargs[string, `$`])
method log*(L: ref TFileLogger; level: TLevel; frmt: string; 
            args: varargs[string, `$`])
method log*(L: ref TRollingFileLogger; level: TLevel; frmt: string; 
            args: varargs[string, `$`])

Templates

template log*(level: TLevel; frmt: string; args: varargs[string, `$`])
logs a message of the given level 
template debug*(frmt: string; args: varargs[string, `$`])
logs a debug message 
template info*(frmt: string; args: varargs[string, `$`])
logs an info message 
template warn*(frmt: string; args: varargs[string, `$`])
logs a warning message 
template error*(frmt: string; args: varargs[string, `$`])
logs an error message 
template fatal*(frmt: string; args: varargs[string, `$`])
logs a fatal error message
